methodology: Web research using WebSearch queries including BuiltWith, Wappalyzer, StackShare, Spryker case studies, and company technology announcements

ecommerce_platform.notes: Ricoh built a digital renewal platform for B2B customers using Spryker Commerce OS

search_provider.notes: No specific search provider detected in web research. Likely using native Spryker search capabilities or custom implementation.

cms.notes: Corporate website CMS not identified in research

companies.spryker_use_case: Digital renewal platform for B2B customers, D2C space expansion
companies.spryker_quote: Spryker works with what we already own and operate alongside anticipating where Ricoh sees itself in the D2C space for the future. - Carin O'Doherty, Director Digital Marketing & Strategy, Ricoh USA
companies.displacement_opportunity: HIGH - Confirmed Spryker customer without Algolia detected

ecommerce_platform.notes: Hilti uses Spryker Commerce OS for B2B Suite, implemented multi-store for Africa (Ghana, Kenya, Nigeria)

search_provider.notes: No specific search provider detected. Using Spryker native search or custom implementation.

cms.notes: Adobe AEM identified via StackShare and technology profiles

personalization.notes: Regional deployments use Salesforce for CRM and personalization

companies.spryker_use_case: Multinational, multilingual online store with multi-currency support for African markets
companies.spryker_quote: Hilti became the world market leader of power tools in the professional construction industry, and the Spryker Commerce OS supports Hilti expanding in a fast and cost-effective manner.
companies.displacement_opportunity: HIGH - Confirmed Spryker customer without Algolia, using Adobe AEM CMS

ecommerce_platform.notes: Spryker Commerce OS for Shop&Go app; SAP Commerce for broader e-commerce operations

search_provider.notes: No specific site search provider detected. Using SAP Commerce or Spryker native capabilities.

cms.notes: AEM as a blueprint for global communication for ALDI websites

analytics.notes: Standard analytics assumed based on 50 technologies installed

companies.spryker_use_case: Digital commerce platform for US market (grocery delivery/curbside pickup) and Shop&Go autonomous store app
companies.displacement_opportunity: MEDIUM - Using SAP Commerce search capabilities, potential for Algolia enhancement

ecommerce_platform.notes: Spryker used by Bosch Digital Platforms India for Mobility marketplace; Virto Commerce for B2B loyalty portal
ecommerce_platform.source: LinkedIn Spryker posts, Virto Commerce case study

search_provider.notes: No specific site search provider detected. Enterprise likely using SAP-integrated search.

cms.notes: Corporate CMS not specifically identified; uses Adobe Creative Cloud for design

analytics.notes: SAP analytics stack with Microsoft collaboration

personalization.notes: Enterprise-grade personalization assumed but not specifically identified

companies.spryker_use_case: Digital marketplace for Mobility division via Bosch Digital Platforms India
companies.displacement_opportunity: HIGH - Large enterprise with Spryker, no Algolia detected

ecommerce_platform.notes: Siemens Healthineers division uses Spryker for spare parts shop and digital commerce

search_provider.notes: Custom AI-powered search using AWS Lambda, Amazon Bedrock, combining 15+ data sources for personalized responses

cms.notes: Bynder serves as central connector with CMS and intranet solutions

personalization.notes: Generative AI search provides personalization capabilities

companies.spryker_use_case: Siemens Healthineers spare parts shop and B2B digital commerce, went live in Brazil in less than 3 months
companies.spryker_quote: Spryker proved that it was able to fulfill over 90% of Siemens' complex use cases.
companies.displacement_opportunity: LOW - Already has sophisticated AI-powered search via AWS Bedrock

ecommerce_platform.notes: METRO and Spryker partnership for B2B online shop targeting traders (small retailers, kiosks)

search_provider.notes: Ecosia is the standard internal search engine for METRO AG and METRO-NOM since June 2018. Site search provider unknown.

cms.notes: 33 technologies detected by BuiltWith but specific CMS not identified

analytics.source: Google Cloud customer case study reference

companies.spryker_use_case: B2B online platform for small retailers/traders in East Europe, API-first standardized backend
companies.displacement_opportunity: HIGH - Confirmed Spryker customer, no advanced site search detected

ecommerce_platform.notes: Jungheinrich Parts Shop with 800,000+ spare parts across 40 countries using Spryker Commerce OS B2B Suite

search_provider.notes: Elastic Search native integration into Spryker for tailored search function

personalization.notes: Real-time pricing based on customer and country via SAP ERP integration

companies.spryker_quote: The optimized service for B2B end customers is already proving fruitful with a marked increase in sales.

ecommerce_platform.notes: ZF partnered with Spryker and diva-e for global aftermarket (auto parts) platform

companies.spryker_use_case: Global aftermarket platform - unified one-stop-shop customer portal for auto parts

search_provider.notes: No specific search provider detected. Likely using Mirakl native search.

companies.spryker_note: Toyota Material Handling uses Mirakl, NOT Spryker. Toyota Deutschland GmbH (different entity) uses Spryker for automotive retail.
companies.displacement_opportunity: MEDIUM - Not a Spryker customer (uses Mirakl), potential for search enhancement

ecommerce_platform.notes: B2B Customer Portal across 3 countries (expanding), live in 3 markets with 300+ customers onboarded

search_provider.notes: No specific search provider detected. Using Spryker native search capabilities.

personalization.notes: B2B Customer Portal provides account-relevant information (form of personalization)

companies.spryker_use_case: B2B Customer Portal consolidating 8 independently operated companies across 10 production sites globally
companies.spryker_quote: Customers in one market ordering every 5 minutes on average.
companies.displacement_opportunity: HIGH - Confirmed Spryker customer, active B2B commerce, no advanced search detected

summary.notes: Most companies are using Spryker native search or have unknown search implementations, presenting significant Algolia co-sell opportunities. Siemens is the exception with advanced AWS Bedrock AI search. Jungheinrich explicitly uses Elasticsearch via Spryker integration.
